channel.title: elections on PepsFeeder
channel.description: Recent content in elections on PepsFeeder

item.title: Jacob Zuma Gets His Revenge on South African Party That Shunned Him
item.description: Jacob Zuma, the former president of South Africa, has been a polarizing figure since he took office in 2009. His tenure was marked by allegations of corruption, economic mismanagement, and a disregard for the rule of law.

item.title: Brexit Champion Says He’ll Run for Parliament, Jolting U.K. Election
item.description: Boris Johnson, the former foreign secretary who has been a leading advocate for Britain leaving the European Union, said on Monday that he would run for Parliament in a by-election in a northern English constituency, a move that could complicate the political landscape in the country.

item.title: A Small Army Combating a Flood of Deepfakes in India’s Election
item.description: The Indian government has deployed a small army of fact-checkers to combat a flood of deepfakes during the country’s general election, which began on Thursday.

item.title: Historic breakthrough of Sinn Fein in the legislative elections in Ireland
item.description: Prime Minister Leo Varadkar’s party, Fine Gael, was the big loser in this Sunday, February 9, election. He comes third. A setback for the party of Prime Minister Leo Varadkar, the Fine Gael, which comes in the third position.

item.title: Israel on the way to new elections in March
item.description: Israelis will go to the polls for the third time in a year. Polls again give Netanyahu and his rival Gantz neck and neck. The Israeli political class was preparing the ground Wednesday evening for new elections, at the beginning of March, the third in less than a year, with the flavor of a new duel between Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, now charged with corruption, and his rival Benny Gantz.

item.title: Algerian interior minister calls election opponents "traitors and gays"
item.description: Algerian Interior Minister Salaheddine Dahmoun provoked controversy after he violently attacked opponents of the December 12 presidential election, calling them “traitors, mercenaries, homosexuals and the remains of colonialism.
